Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    an object that extends the JPanel object it holds the main game play of the game
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GamePanel()
      the constructor for game panel sets the background color based on the settings initializes all the paddles and ball also initializes the key listener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean ballCollidesBorders()
      checks if the ball collides with one of the upper or lower borders if it does the reflect the y speed of the ball
      boolean ballCollidesPaddles()
      checks if the ball collides with one of the paddles if it does then reflect the x speed of the ball
      boolean ballScored()
      checks if the ball collides with one of the left or right borders if it does then the score of the paddle that is opposite of the border gains a point and the ball is served in the direction of the paddle that got scored on
      void checkIfWon()
      checks if the points required to win the game has been reached by one of the players if it has then the game over method is called
      void checkPaddleCollisionBorders(Paddle paddle)
      checks if the paddle has reached the edge of the game screen if it has then the paddle is not able to move in that direction anymore
      void drawDashedLine(java.awt.Graphics g, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      draws a dashed line based on the parameters
      void gameOver(Paddle paddle)
      removes the key listener from the panel to stop anymore movement creates the winner label with the name of the paddle outputs the results to the game logs
      void moveBall()
      moves the ball based on its speed also checks if the ball reaches the left or right end
      void movePaddles(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> keysPressed)
      moves the paddles based on the keys within the array parameter also starts the round if the round has been ended
      void outputToGameLog(Paddle paddle)
      outputs the winner of the game to the game log text file with the current date
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      draws all the objects including the paddles, the ball, and the dashed line
      void resetRound()
      resets the paddles and ball to their starting positions disables the keyListener until a key is released and pressed again sets the round started variable to false
      void run()
      renders the game based on the REFRESH_TIME runs in a constant loop until the game is exited
      void startRound()
      starts the round by setting the round started variable to true and serving the ball
      void update()
      updates the positions of the paddle and the ball

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        renders the game based on the REFRESH_TIME runs in a constant loop until the game is exited
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when another thread attempts to interrupt

        x1 - the starting x position of the line
        y1 - the starting y position of the line
        x2 - the ending x position of the line

      • checkPaddleCollisionBorders

        public void checkPaddleCollisionBorders(Paddle paddle)
        checks if the paddle has reached the edge of the game screen if it has then the paddle is not able to move in that direction anymore
        Parameters:
        paddle - the paddle that is being tracked

      • moveBall

        public void moveBall()
        moves the ball based on its speed also checks if the ball reaches the left or right end

      • ballCollidesPaddles

        public boolean ballCollidesPaddles()
        checks if the ball collides with one of the paddles if it does then reflect the x speed of the ball
        Returns:
        true if the ball has hit a paddle, otherwise returns false

      • ballCollidesBorders

        public boolean ballCollidesBorders()
        checks if the ball collides with one of the upper or lower borders if it does the reflect the y speed of the ball
        Returns:
        true if the ball has hit one of the borders, otherwise returns false

      • ballScored

        public boolean ballScored()
        checks if the ball collides with one of the left or right borders if it does then the score of the paddle that is opposite of the border gains a point and the ball is served in the direction of the paddle that got scored on
        Returns:
        true if the ball hit one of the borders, otherwise returns false

      • resetRound

        public void resetRound()
        resets the paddles and ball to their starting positions disables the keyListener until a key is released and pressed again sets the round started variable to false

      • startRound

        public void startRound()
        starts the round by setting the round started variable to true and serving the ball

      • checkIfWon

        public void checkIfWon()
        checks if the points required to win the game has been reached by one of the players if it has then the game over method is called

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver(Paddle paddle)
        removes the key listener from the panel to stop anymore movement creates the winner label with the name of the paddle outputs the results to the game logs
        Parameters:
        paddle - the paddle that won

      • outputToGameLog

        public void outputToGameLog(Paddle paddle)
        outputs the winner of the game to the game log text file with the current date
        Parameters:
        paddle - the paddle that won
